skill.name: scoop-ui-refactor
skill.description: Project-specific UI refactor workflow for the Scoop news platform in /home/bender/classwork/Thesis. Use when updating Scoop frontend layouts, globe UX, research workspace, and brand docs while preserving all features and enforcing a no-emoji policy across UI, logs, and docs.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only workflow instructions for UI refactoring. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution capabilities. The skill describes desired outcomes and patterns without implementing them.

content.value_statement: The Scoop news platform has a cluttered frontend with excessive vertical space and inconsistent design patterns. This skill provides a structured workflow to compress layouts, improve density, add snap-scroll navigation, and enforce a clean no-emoji policy across the entire frontend.
actual_capabilities: Refactor home page layout to increase density and reduce empty space
Improve globe view with country focus headers and source counts
Implement TikTok-style snap-scroll feed with keyboard and touch support
Remove all emoji usage from UI, logs, and documentation
Restructure research workspace with query bar and Brief/Flow modes
Preserve existing features including view modes, filters, and modals
limitations: Only works within the /home/bender/classwork/Thesis project directory
Cannot modify backend code or API endpoints
Does not create new features from scratch, only refactors existing ones
Requires existing React/Next.js frontend structure to apply changes

use_cases.title: Refactor news platform UI
use_cases.description: Compress layouts and add snap-scroll to improve user engagement and content density on the Scoop news platform

use_cases.title: Improve globe interaction
use_cases.description: Add clear country focus states and source information to make the interactive globe more usable for news exploration

use_cases.title: Enforce brand consistency
use_cases.description: Remove emojis from UI and documentation to maintain a professional, consistent brand appearance across all surfaces

prompt_templates.title: Quick layout refactor
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor the Scoop home page to increase density. Compress the lead story into title + summary + action row. Move narrative blocks into compact summary cards. Keep view mode controls visible and separated.

prompt_templates.title: Add snap-scroll feed
prompt_templates.prompt: Add snap-scroll to the Scoop feed. Use full-viewport sections with snap-y snap-mandatory. Support wheel, touch, and arrow keys. Keep header accessible at top-level scroll. Preserve modals and feed actions.

prompt_templates.title: Fix globe UX
prompt_templates.prompt: Improve the globe view UX on Scoop. Add a clear country focus header showing source count and top sources. Add a visible reset action. Remove all country flag emojis.

prompt_templates.title: Remove all emojis
prompt_templates.prompt: Remove all emoji usage from the Scoop frontend. Use ripgrep to find emojis in UI strings, logs, and docs. Replace with icons or text labels. Confirm no emojis remain in the codebase.

best_practices: Review primary surfaces (page.tsx, globe-view.tsx, globals.css) before making changes
Use flex parent with min-h-0 to prevent snap-scroll from clipping content
Test snap-scroll with wheel, touch, and arrow keys to verify all input methods work
Run existing tests after refactoring to confirm no regressions in modals and filters
anti_patterns: Using fixed h-screen without accounting for surrounding layout (causes content clipping)
Blocking all scroll events instead of only preventing default during snap transitions
Forgetting to preserve global header visibility when implementing snap-scroll
Modifying emoji in only one location without checking logs and docs

faq.question: Which frontend files does this skill modify?
faq.answer: The skill targets frontend/app/page.tsx, frontend/components/globe-view.tsx, frontend/components/interactive-globe.tsx, frontend/app/search/page.tsx, and frontend/app/globals.css.

faq.question: What happens to existing features during refactoring?
faq.answer: The skill explicitly preserves all existing features including view modes, filters, modals, bookmarks, likes, and favorites. Checks confirm these still work after changes.

faq.question: Does this skill modify backend code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only works on frontend React/Next.js code in the frontend/app and frontend/components directories. Backend code is out of scope.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill that provides instructions to your AI assistant. It does not execute code, access files outside the project, or transmit data externally.

faq.question: Why does snap-scroll sometimes clip content?
faq.answer: Snap-scroll clips content when sections use fixed h-screen without accounting for surrounding layout. Use flex parent with flex-1 h-full min-h-0 and per-section h-full min-h-full snap-start instead.

faq.question: How is this different from a general UI refactor skill?
faq.answer: This skill is specifically designed for the Scoop news platform with knowledge of its file structure, existing components, and feature set. It provides targeted, project-specific guidance rather than generic refactoring patterns.
